meanings.definition: The action of degrading someone to the status of a mere object.
meanings.sent1: The objectification of individuals diminishes their worth.
meanings.sent2: She felt the objectification of being reduced to just a tool.
meanings.sent3: The objectification of the chair as a person in the play was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In the artist's painting, the objectification of nature as a woman was striking.
meanings.sent5: The objectification of the sculpture made it seem almost lifelike.

meanings.definition: The act of treating someone as an object for one's own pleasure or benefit.
meanings.sent1: Objectification in relationships can lead to emotional harm.
meanings.sent2: He used her for his own gain, a clear case of objectification.
meanings.sent3: The objectification of the cat as a servant in the story was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The objectification of time as a thief is a common metaphor.
meanings.sent5: The objectification of the toy made it irresistible to children.
